meanings.definition: The quality or state of being perceptible.
meanings.sent1: The perceptibility of the bright colors made the painting stand out.
meanings.sent2: The perceptibility of the sound alerted the animals in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The perceptibility of the smell from the bakery made everyone hungry.
meanings.sent4: The perceptibility of the tension in the room could be cut with a knife.
meanings.sent5: The perceptibility of the heat from the fire warmed the entire room.

meanings.definition: The ability to be perceived by the senses.
meanings.sent1: The baby's perceptibility of touch helped them explore the world around them.
meanings.sent2: The perceptibility of the delicious aroma drew people into the bakery.
meanings.sent3: The perceptibility of the loud music made everyone start dancing.
meanings.sent4: The perceptibility of the tension in the air was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The perceptibility of the cold wind made everyone shiver.
